definitions.definition: move from a lower position to a higher one; come or go up.
examples: the tiny aircraft rose from the ground

definitions.definition: (of the sun, moon, or another celestial body) appear above the horizon.
examples: the sun had just risen

definitions.definition: (of a fish) come to the surface of water.
examples: a fish rose and was hooked and landed

definitions.definition: (of a voice) become higher in pitch.
examples: my voice rose an octave or two as I screamed

definitions.definition: reach a higher position in society or one's profession.
examples: the officer was a man of great courage who had risen from the ranks
synonyms: be promoted "he rose through the ranks"

definitions.definition: succeed in not being limited or constrained by (a restrictive environment or situation).
examples: he struggled to rise above his humble background

definitions.definition: be superior to.
examples: I try to rise above prejudice

definitions.definition: get up from lying, sitting, or kneeling.
examples: she pushed back her chair and rose
synonyms: leap up; formalarise "he rose from his chair"

definitions.definition: get out of bed, especially in the morning.
examples: I rose and got dressed
synonyms: be up and about; Moreinformalrise and shine

definitions.definition: (of a meeting or a session of a court) adjourn.
examples: the judge's remark heralded the signal for the court to rise
synonyms: take five "the court rose at midday"

definitions.definition: be restored to life.
examples: your sister has risen from the dead

definitions.definition: (of a wind) start to blow or to blow more strongly.
examples: the wind continued to rise

definitions.definition: (of a river) have its source.
examples: the Euphrates rises in Turkey
synonyms: emanate from "the river rises in the mountains"

definitions.definition: cease to be submissive, obedient, or peaceful.
examples: the activists urged militant factions to rise up
synonyms: take up arms "the nation rose against its oppressors"

definitions.definition: (of a person) react with annoyance or argument to (provocation).
examples: he didn't rise to my teasing
synonyms: respond to; take "she wouldn't rise to the bait"

definitions.definition: find the strength or ability to respond adequately to (a challenging situation).
examples: many participants in the race had never sailed before, but they rose to the challenge

definitions.definition: (of land or a feature following the contours of the land) incline upward; become higher.
examples: the moorlands rise and fall in gentle folds

definitions.definition: (of a building, mountain, or other high object or structure) be much taller than the surrounding landscape.
examples: the cliff rose more than a hundred feet above us

definitions.definition: (of someone's hair) stand on end.
examples: he felt the hairs rise on the back of his neck

definitions.definition: (of a building) undergo construction from the foundations.
examples: rows of two-story houses are slowly rising

definitions.definition: (of dough) swell by the action of yeast.
examples: leave the dough in a warm place to rise
synonyms: puff up "the dough started to rise"

definitions.definition: (of a bump, blister, or weal) appear as a swelling on the skin.
examples: blisters rose on his burned hand

definitions.definition: (of a person's stomach) become nauseated.
examples: Fabio's stomach rose at the foul bedding

definitions.definition: increase in number, size, amount, or quality.
examples: land prices had risen

definitions.definition: (of the sea, a river, or other body of water) increase in height to a particular level, typically through tidal action or flooding.
examples: the river level rose so high the work had to be abandoned

definitions.definition: (of an emotion) develop and become more intense.
examples: he felt a tide of resentment rising in him

definitions.definition: (of a sound) become louder; be audible above other sounds.
examples: her voice rose above the clamor

definitions.definition: (of a person's mood) become more cheerful.
examples: her spirits rose as they left the ugly city behind
synonyms: pick up; informalbuck up "her spirits rose"

definitions.definition: (of the color in a person's face) become deeper, especially as a result of embarrassment.
examples: he was teasing her, and she could feel her color rising

definitions.definition: (of a barometer or other measuring instrument) give a higher reading.
approaching (a specified age).
examples: she was thirty-nine rising forty

definitions.definition: an upward movement; an instance of becoming higher.
examples: the bird has a display flight of steep flapping rises

definitions.definition: an act of a fish moving to the surface to take a fly or bait.
an increase in sound or pitch.
examples: the rise and fall of his voice

definitions.definition: an instance of social, commercial, or political advancement.
examples: few models have had such a meteoric rise

definitions.definition: an upward slope or hill.
examples: slope, incline, hillock, hill; eminence we walked up the rise

definitions.definition: the vertical height of a step, arch, or incline.
another term for riser (sense 2).
an increase in amount, extent, size, or number.
examples: local people are worried by the rise in crime

definitions.definition: an increase in salary or wages.
a source; an origin.
examples: it was here that the brook had its rise
